Posts.Content: I was diagnosed with full blown prostate cancer 2/1/2014 Surgery / Removal not a good option due to my 285lb size and tests were not 100% certain that it has not spread outside the prostate. I totally agree because exploration is risky due to an increased chance of a rapid growth rate. I've been on hormone therapy, pills and injections, from day 1 and the loss of emotional control has been quite the challenge. Normally I am in complete control of emotional response. I will be starting my 18th treatment of Beam Radiation 12 positions @ 20 sec. ea. I've been given a diet witch I stick to, I'm feeling pretty run down most likely cause I urinate 5 or 6 times a night not much sleep. I'm still working 40+ hrs. a week. Oh and my wife of 30 yrs. is getting her sexual needs met from an outside source. This used to be my night job and I'm certain I was good at it. QUESTION IS: What can I expect in the coming weeks and months, Mainly with my health. All comments welcome:
Posts.Title: What can I expect after 18 beam Radiation Treatments and should I get regular PSA tes

Posts.Title: What can I expect after 18 beam Radiation Treatments and should I get regular PSA tes

Posts.Content: Well, tomorrow will be the 39th day of 45 IMRT. That's only 6 more treatments, @ $100.00 per treatment. I'll be looking forward to some recovery time both physically and financially. On a more positive note: The side effects from Radiation and HT seem to be leveling off or I've learned to manage them better, or the drugs are wearing off. If it was not for my marital issues, witch at this point could go either way, I would have to say it's going good! Time will tell.

Posts.Title: What can I expect after 18 beam Radiation Treatments and should I get regular PSA tes

Posts.Content: Hi Arthro92, My experience with Flomax that I take daily comes from my PC. Well about 10 days into the 45 days of IMRT I started having urinary issues. Having to go 5-7 times a night producing very little pee each time, not to mention no sleep and still work 40-50 hrs. a week. My Onc. prescribed Flomax 1xD taken in the early evening and it made ALL THE DIFFERENCE I COULD HOPE FOR. I still have go 1 maybe 2 times a night and back to normal during the day. I can only tell you how the Flomax worked for me, as I have never taken Saw Palmetto. Hope this helps. Rob
Posts.Signature: 53 yrs. 6' 4" 285 lb. in general good health Feb. 2014 PSA 17.5 DRE BPH no lmps. local Uro confirm PSA, DRE, bone scan neg. ct scan neg. biopsy confirm(adenocarcinoma)12/12 cores gleason 4+5=9 @115 gr. (70%-100%) involved. no perineural invasion Mar. 2014 start HT (lup/cas) (surgery not an option due to size, and chance of spread to nodes)May 2014 start (IMRT) rec. 3 tatts (alignment) 45 days 9 pos. 20 sec. ea. (linear excel.)@ MOJAVE RADIATION ONCOLOGY CENTER Jun. 2014 start (flomax) 2xd urination issues, big help! July-9-2014 finish (IMRT) follow up in 2 wks. PSA in 3 months No serious side effects from (IMRT) stamina and urination (minimal) HT cont. (NO FUN) PSA as of 9-18-14 2.02 (Nadir) Stop HT retest 3 mo. I work harder @ staying positive than I do @ beating CANCER!
Posts.Title: Flomax vs. Saw Palmetto

Posts.Content: Hi Aloysius, sorry I do not have for sure answer for you, but I'm guessing that parts f,h, and i are a poor attempt to describe the 3 cores that are positive. Part (f) is the (LA) core, Part (h) is the (RM) core, and Part (i) is the (RA) core. I have never seen the "ERG POSITIVE" or "PTEN". It is possible the pathologist trained outside the U.S. or Canada and these are interpretative of his language. I would get a 2nd opinion from a different pathologist and see if the terminology clears things up, for all of us that stumped. I wish you the best of luck. Rob

Posts.Title: Another Newbie

Posts.Content: Hi Nicnic, a lot of the awesome people in here tend to lean toward the surgery side of things and that's is a pretty good option if you are ok with surgery. However, there are a lot of non surgical treatments that have had as good if not better results. Radiation with hormone therapy is a very effective option. This is just food for thought from my own experience as surgery was never an option. I am not a medical professional only a professional patient. I suggest you wait 30 days and get another PSA test just to be sure of accuracy. Remember to avoid any sexual activity or strenuous exercise, caffeine or alcohol the day before you test as this will elevate the PSA. Get Dr. Walsh's book information abound. Good Luck Rob

Posts.Title: Confuzed

Posts.Content: Welcome Nicnic, and like the others were all sorry you have to be here. Like Jim215 said the more info you can share the better feedback you'll get. There are a lot of knowledgeable great people at your service so be assured you'll get really good advice. Here are some things you'll need to post. The complete Pathology Report (Biopsy) How many cores tested? How many cores were positive and the percentage of involvement? The last PSA test? Any Perineural Invasion? Gleason Grade? Have you had a Bone Scan or a CT Scan if so what are the results? I know this is all new and scary stuff, however, from the info you did share there is no need to panic or rush into any type of surgery or treatment until you have all the tests needed to formulate a treatment plan that YOU! are comfortable with. At this point Active Surveilance could be way to go. Good Luck. Rob

Posts.Title: Confuzed

Posts.Content: #1 I started HT because the Uro said Radiation coupled with HT is the most effective treatment for a non surgical case. Would I do HT with what I know and how it effected me, NO. However it effects everyone different and there is no way to know for sure until you do it. Remember you are in control of the entire process, making choices you are comfortable with and have no regrets is a #1 priority. #2 Not before ,during or after all good in that dept. #3 Yes half way through IMRT my existing urinary issues did get worse. Having to go 5-7 times a night sleep and fatigue became an issue. The Onc. started me on FLOMAX taken in the early evening fixed all those issues with continued use. Hope this helps Good Luck! Rob

Posts.Title: External beam radiation: side effects, experiences?

Posts.Content: Hi bobkeenan, there is a Sticky about EBR you may want to look at, should be helpfull. For me surgery was never an option so IMRT and HT are the primary treatments. I completed 45 days of IMRT while on HT on July 9 2014. The post for all my experiences would be enormous so if you have specific questions I'd be happy to help. Your post is not clear weather or not you have started any kind of treatment? so let's start there. Read my signature and you'll know if my journey is the info that will answer some questions for you. There are are a lot of smart, knowledgeable folks here that you can rely on for good honest answers. Without there help this would have been a very different post. Rob

Posts.Title: External beam radiation: side effects, experiences?

Posts.Content: Pathology Report:Part A: LLB Prostatic Adenocarcinoma, Gleason 4+4=8 13mm involving 95% Part B: LLM Prostatic Adenocarcinoma, Gleason 3+4=7 6mm involving 70% Part C: LLA Prostatic Adenocarcinoma, Gleason 4+4=8 8mm involving 100% Part D: LB Prostatic Adenocarcinoma, Gleason 4+4=8 13mm involving 95% Part E: LM Prostatic Adenocarcinoma, Gleason 4+5=9 13mm involving 95% Part F: LA Prostatic Adenocarcinoma, Gleason 4+4=8 11mm involving 60% Part G: RB Prostatic Adenocarcinoma, Gleason 4+4=8 13mm involving 95% Part H: RM Prostatic Adenocarcinoma, Gleason 4+3=7 8mm involving 100% Part I: RA Prostatic Adenocarcinoma, Gleason 4+4=8 6mm involving 100% Part J: RLB Prostatic Adenocarcinoma, Gleason 4+4=8 14mm involving 95% Part K: RLM Prostatic Adenocarcinoma, Gleason 4+4=8 15mm involving 100% Part L: RLA Prostatic Adenocarcinoma, Gleason 4+4=8 4mm involving 50% Prostate Weight: 115 grams. No Perineural Invasion ID PSA 17.5
Posts.Title: Hormone Therapy is my KRYPTONITE

Posts.Content: Is it just me or does any one have a hard time dealing with the effects of HT. Things like: Hot Flashes, severe joint pain, Mood Swings, Fits of Rage to deeply Depressed, I never know what's coming and the ability to control these emotions get's tougher every day. Diagnosed with PC 2-1-14 this is all new and over whelming. I was in denial the first Biopsy so I really was not listening to the wa wa wa wa my urologist was telling me. So now I playing catch up and here is what I know. PSA 17.5 12/12 Cores Pos. CT Scan Inconclusive Bone Scan Neg. Surgery not an option Hormone Therapy: Pills and Injections IMRT 26 of 45 Treatments. 9 positions @ 20 sec. ea. I have 3 Tats for alignment What comes after IMRT ? F#$%^ Cancer
Posts.Title: Hormone Therapy is my KRYPTONITE

No Perineural Invasion ID PSA 17.5
Posts.Title: Hormone Therapy is my KRYPTONITE

Posts.Content: mom2two, A warm welcome to the site, and we are sorry that you have to be here. First of all there is a lot in your favor from the pathology report so no need to panic. The amount of cores (2) and the lower percentage of involvement could be that you caught it early enough to be treatable with really good results. The Gleason Grade of an 4+4=8 suggests that you have a little time, a second opinion is never a bad call. Per the pathology a tumor of 7mm outside the rectal wall, is that correct? Just relax and wait until all of the tests are in. Most likely another CT scan, a bone scan and I did not see a PSA. I cant comment on the surgery side of things as surgery was never an option for me. Radiation and Hormone Therapy is the path I'm on. I have 6 of 45 IMRT left to go. However, there a lot of people on the site that can give you opinions and advice you can trust, I know this because they give me the support and questions you need to be asking the Dr. I hope it all goes smoothly and turns out well!!! Rob

Surgery not an option Hormone Therapy: Pills and Injections IMRT 26 of 45 Treatments. 9 positions @ 20 sec. ea. I have 3 Tats for alignment What comes after IMRT ? F#$%^ Cancer
Posts.Title: Hormone Therapy is my KRYPTONITE

Posts.Content: mom2two, A warm welcome to the site, and we are sorry that you have to be here. First of all there is a lot in your favor from the pathology report so no need to panic. The amount of cores (2) and the lower percentage of involvement could be that you caught it early enough to be treatable with really good results. The Gleason Grade of an 4+4=8 suggests that you have a little time, a second opinion is never a bad call. Per the pathology a tumor of 7mm outside the rectal wall, is that correct? Just relax and wait until all of the tests are in. Most likely another CT scan, a bone scan and I did not see a PSA. I cant comment on the surgery side of things as surgery was never an option for me. Radiation and Hormone Therapy is the path I'm on. I have 6 of 45 IMRT left to go. However, there a lot of people on the site that can give you opinions and advice you can trust, I know this because they give me the support and questions you need to be asking the Dr. I hope it all goes smoothly and turns out well!!! Rob

Posts.Title: I need some support...

Posts.Content: Fairwind, my PSA was a 17.5 with a gleason 9 and 12/12 cores pos that range from 70-100% involved. A PSA of 50-100 sounds a little out of wack for PC but I have seen these numbers in cases of LYMPHOMA. Is it really possible to have a PSA 50-100 for PC? Rob
Posts.Signature: 53 yrs. 6' 4" 285 lb. in general good health Feb. 2014 PSA 17.5 DRE BPH no lmps. local Uro confirm PSA, DRE, bone scan neg. ct scan neg. biopsy confirm(adenocarcinoma)12/12 cores gleason 4+5=9 @115 gr. (70%-100%) involved. no perineural invasion Mar. 2014 start HT (lup/cas) (surgery not an option due to size, and chance of spread to nodes)May 2014 start (IMRT) rec. 3 tatts (alignment) 45 days 9 pos. 20 sec. ea. (linear excel.)@ MOJAVE RADIATION ONCOLOGY CENTER Jun. 2014 start (flomax) 2xd urination issues, big help! July-9-2014 finish (IMRT) follow up in 2 wks. PSA in 3 months No serious side effects from (IMRT) stamina and urination (minimal) HT cont. (NO FUN) PSA as of 9-18-14 2.02 (Nadir) Stop HT retest 3 mo. I work harder @ staying positive than I do @ beating CANCER!

Posts.Title: At what stage does PC spread

Posts.Content: I just did not think to ask the Uro about how the Gleason Score is determined. The Pathology Report is broken down into 12 individual tests. One test for each core of the Prostate, each with it's own Gleason Score. However, not all of the Gleason Scores are the same. I've seen other pathology Reports on the sight and most have just one Gleason Score. My question is how is the Gleason Score determined, are the 12 scores averaged or is the high or lo score used? I should know the answer but I really didn't hear any thing after YOU HAVE CANCER that after noon, so I'm playing catch up on many areas of the process. All comments welcome.
Posts.Title: Gleason Score: 12 individual or Average of All?

Posts.Content: HighlanderCFH, Well ok thanks for the very detailed explanation. I am in the middle of RT so the only PSA I have is the initial test before the biopsy and that was 17.5 Early Detection Would Have Been The Key
Posts.Title: Gleason Score: 12 individual or Average of All?

Posts.Content: To be clear: out of 12 cores I have 1 core scored at 3+4=7 (lowest score) and 1 core scored at 4+5=9 (highest score) the rest of the cores scored at 4+4=8 my true Gleason Score is 4+5=9 is that how it works?
Posts.Title: Gleason Score: 12 individual or Average of All?

Posts.Content: Yes I was hit in the upper thigh by a Mojave Green Snake on Mon. 4th 2014. I was able to get treated within about an hour and a half. It hurt like hell for 2 days and it looks like I got beat with a baseball bat. So the question is will the toxins have any effects on PC?
